citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of Methanobacterium uliginosum sp. nov. from a marshy soil.

p.s: Description of Methanobacterium uliginosum sp. nov.
Methanobacterium uliginosum (u.li.gi.nos'um L. neutrer adj. uliginosus occuring in marshy soil)
Gram-positive rods, about 1.9-3.9 μm in length and 0.2-0.6 μm in diameter.
Pseudomurein sacculi present containing both GlcN and GaIN.
THe G+C content of the DNA is 29.4 mol% (melting-point analysis) and 33.8% (direct nucleotide analysis).
Resistant against penicillin and ampicillin (100 μg/mL).
The rods can release small spherical cells.
DNA-DNA homology value of 53% with Methanobacterium bryantii strain M.o.H., and a value of 7% with Methanobacterium bryantii strain M.o.H-G.
Only H2-CO2 is used as sole energy and carbon source.
Yeast extract, peptone, acetate, and formate not required.
The type strain is strain P2St DSM 2956 Göttingen, Federal Republic of Germany.
